se.mockachino
Class Mockachino

java.lang.Object
  se.mockachino.matchers.MatchersBase
      se.mockachino.matchers.Matchers
          se.mockachino.Mockachino

public class Mockachino
extends Matchers

This is the main entry point of all your mocking needs. All operations delegates to a singleton MockContext.

For most use cases, using this singleton is the most convenient approach, but are also free to use a MockContext object directly.

Consider statically import this class to increase the readability.

See MatchersBase for available matchers and see Matchers for useful matcher shortcuts.

public static <T> T mock(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
Creates a new mock with a default handler

Parameters:

Returns:
a mock object of the same class

mock

public static <T> T mock(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                         java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler handler)
Creates a new mock with a custom handler.

Parameters:
clazz - the class of the returned object
handler - the handler that is called for each mock method invocation

spy

public static <T> T spy(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                        T impl)
Creates a mock that spies on a specific object. Unless overridden by stubbing, spied on object will be called for all invocations

Parameters:
clazz - the class to spy with, must be a superclass of impl
impl - the object to spy on.
Returns:
the mock object

spy

public static <T> T spy(T impl)
Creates a mock that spies on a specific object. Unless overridden by stubbing, spied on object will be called for all invocations

Parameters:
impl - the object to spy on
Returns:
a mock object of the same class as impl

verifyOrder

public static OrderingContext verifyOrder()
Creates a new ordering context which is used to verify method calls in order. Ordering contexts are completely independent of each other. Typical usage: 
 OrderingContext context = Mockachino.verifyOrder();
 context.verifyAtLeast(3).on(mock).method();

Returns:
the new ordering context

verifyNever

public static VerifyRangeStart verifyNever()
Verifies that a method call is never called. Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.verifyNever().on(mock).method();

Returns:
a verifier

verifyOnce

public static VerifyRangeStart verifyOnce()
Verifies that a method call is only called exactly once. Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.verifyOnce().on(mock).method();

Returns:
a verifier

verifyAtLeast

public static VerifyRangeStart verifyAtLeast(int min)
Verifies that a method call is called at least a specific number of times. Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.verifyAtLeast(3).on(mock).method();

Parameters:
min - number of times the method should be called
Returns:
a verifier

verifyAtMost

public static VerifyRangeStart verifyAtMost(int max)
Verifies that a method call is called at most a specific number of times. Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.verifyAtMost(3).on(mock).method();

Parameters:
max - number of times the method should be called
Returns:
a verifier

verifyRange

public static VerifyRangeStart verifyRange(int min,
                                           int max)
Verifies that a method call is called between min and max times, inclusive. Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.verifyRange(1, 2).on(mock).method();

Parameters:
min - minimum amount of matching method calls
max - maximum amount of matching method calls
Returns:
a verifier

verifyExactly

public static VerifyRangeStart verifyExactly(int count)
Verifies that a method call is called an exact number of times. Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.verifyExactly(3).on(mock).method();

Parameters:
count - number of times the method should be called
Returns:
a verifier

stubThrow

public static StubThrow stubThrow(java.lang.Throwable e)
Stubs a method call to throw an exception Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.stubThrow(myException).on(mock).method();

Parameters:
e - the exception to throw
Returns:
a stubber

stubReturn

public static StubReturn stubReturn(java.lang.Object returnValue)
Stubs a method call to return a specific value Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.stubReturn(value).on(mock).method();
Note that the type of the value must match the return type of the method call. This is checked at runtime and will throw a UsageError if they don't match.

Parameters:
returnValue - the returnValue to return when the method is called.
Returns:
a stubber

stubAnswer

public static StubAnswer stubAnswer(Answer answer)
Stubs a method call with a specific answer strategy Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.stubAnswer(answer).on(mock).method();
All matching method calls will invoke the getValue()-method on the answer-object.

Parameters:
answer - the answer to use
Returns:
a stubber

listenWith

public static ListenerAdder listenWith(MethodCallListener listener)
Add a listener on a specific method. Every time the method is called on the mock, this listener will get a callback. Typical usage: 
 Mockachino.listenWith(myListener).on(mock).method();

Parameters:
listener - the listener
Returns:
a listener adder

getCalls

public static java.util.List<MethodCall> getCalls(java.lang.Object mock)
Get a list of all calls made for a mock. This may be useful for debugging.

Parameters:
mock -
Returns:
the list of calls.
